name: University of Media, Arts and Communication

note: The University of Media, Arts and Communication (UniMAC) was established in 2020 through the merger of the Ghana Institute of Journalism (GIJ), Ghana Institute of Languages (GIL), and the National Film and Television Institute (NAFTI).

UniMAC is Ghana's specialised public university for media, communication, film, and language education, offering programmes through its three constituent institutes: Institute of Journalism, Institute of Film and Television, and Institute of Languages.

note: The School of Graduate Studies and Research (SoGSaR) at UniMAC coordinates all postgraduate programmes including taught master's, research master's, and the newly launched PhD in Media and Communication.
Postgraduate programmes are delivered in regular mode (lectures from 3pm weekdays) and weekend mode (Fridays and Saturdays), making them accessible to working professionals.

mode: Regular mode: Lectures from 3pm weekdays (Monday-Thursday)
Weekend mode: Fridays at 3pm and Saturdays at 7:30am
entry_requirements: Bachelor's degree in Communication Studies from UniMAC or any accredited university with at least Second Class Lower Division
Bachelor's degree in other disciplines from a reputable university with at least Second Class Lower Division
Third Class degree holders with 4 years relevant working experience may apply
level_note: 15-month intensive taught master's programme with dissertation component.
Delivered in partnership with industry practitioners from leading Ghanaian media houses.

level_note: Designed for MA holders who want to upgrade to an MPhil through thesis completion.

courses.course_name: Doctor of Philosophy in Media and Communication

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 17,250 per year (Year One, subject to review)
mode: Blended mode: virtual and in-person lectures
Collaboration with Virginia Tech University (USA) and Nelson Mandela University (South Africa)
entry_requirements: Master's degree in a communication-related field from an accredited university with CGPA of 3.0 and above
MPhil or MFA in a communication-related field from an accredited university
At least grade B in master's Dissertation/Thesis; must submit a 3,000-word research proposal and pass selection interview
level_note: UniMAC's first doctoral programme, launched in November 2024 under the School of Graduate Studies and Research (SoGSaR).
Specialisation strands: Media and Journalism, Political Communication, Public Relations, Marketing and Advertising, Development Communication, and Theatre Studies.
